Altruista Health is seeking the right candidate to join our dynamic and growing technology company (US healthcare domain) as a Network Administrator.

The Network Administrator maintains and adjusts the network as needed ensuring maximum uptime, through monitoring, auditing, and reviewing network performance and security.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

The Network Administrator is not a supervisory role.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field (Master’s Degree preferred)
4+ years of related work experience
Proven experience in a network administrator role
Information Technology experience working with LAN/WAN routing and switching, load balancing, and network support
Experience with VPN connectivity for an enterprise organization (site-to-site and remote client access)

COMPETENCIES

Sense of ownership and responsibility towards problems and solutions
Advanced problem-solving skills to identify and resolve complex issues in a timely manner

Ability to manage Cisco networking devices (IOS knowledge)
Adequate knowledge in Visio, Word, Excel or equivalent tools
Ability to participate in on-call rotation - may include after-hours work
Understanding of network SNMP monitoring and use of configuration auditing and back up tools
Working knowledge of command-line driven configurations required
Attention to detail

Oral communications ability
The job may require occasional international travel.
WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The tasks will generally be performed in a typical office environment.

LOCATION/TRAVEL

Job Description:
We are revolutionizing technical hiring by giving companies a skills-based hiring platform that enables our customers to assess technical skills effectively. We are growing fast and looking to add to our Engineering team. This position is full-time and based in Bangalore or remote within India.
As a Software Engineer, you will play a pivotal part in HackerRank's mission to "Accelerate the World's Innovation". You are excited to make an impact over millions of fellow developers and enjoy building products with a large scale. We're responsible for building the world's leading technical interview platform. We believe in "Extreme ownership" and you'll have immense ownership both in terms of product and engineering.
Your work will have a direct impact on the lives of millions of developers as you build the platform for them to showcase their skills and get hired. You will be responsible for building systems that back the projects product-line.. As part of this, you will need to build a platform to provide world-class developer experience (Coding editor, Autocomplete, Linting, Ability to run code easily, etc) on the cloud at scale. We periodically conduct hiring events across the entire country and you will be responsible to scale our platform to support that. Along with all of this, as a lead developer you will also be responsible for mentoring developers, setting the engineering standards across the org and leading some of our internal cross team tech initiatives.
You will be working on:
As an SDE-2, you will be expected to execute and deliver even large and complex projects end-to-end, with the involvement of other team members.
Gain Expertise and become the go-to person for the team for guidance and troubleshooting.
Proactively participate in code reviews and architecture and design discussions.
Ensuring timely delivery of all product deliverables.
Mentoring junior engineers and setting best practices for coding, code reviews, etc.
Ensuring performance and scalability in all new product features being developed.
We are looking for:
Overall of 2+ years expertise in at least one dynamic programming language and one MVC web framework, preferably Ruby on Rails.
Experience in working on large/key projects and products from scratch will be a big plus.
Good knowledge in Database modelling, preferably relational DB, spotting DB bottlenecks and writing optimized DB queries.
Well versed in all common AWS Cloud technologies, Knowledge of CI/CD tools and workflows.
Nice to have:
It is good to have knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker and related deployment technologies.
Benefits & Perks:
As if working alongside the smartest brains wasn't enough. We have a full package of competitive benefits and perks which include:
Insurance to all employees (term life, personal accident, medical, gratuity) along with medical insurance for their dependents
Employee stock options, flexible work hours, and time off
Employee Reimbursements on gym, telephone, internet, and more
Daily free lunches and delicious snacks
About HackerRank:
HackerRank is a Y Combinator alumnus backed by tier-one Silicon Valley VCs with total funding of over $58 million. The HackerRank Developer Skills Platform is the standard for assessing developer skills for 2,000+ companies across industries and 7M+ developers around the world. Companies like LinkedIn, Stripe, and Peloton rely on HackerRank to objectively evaluate skills against millions of developers at every step of the hiring process, allowing teams to hire the best and reduce engineering time. Developers rely on HackerRank to turn their skills into great jobs. We're data-driven givers who take full ownership of our work and love delighting our customers!
